## Purpose
Core style system for Pygments syntax highlighting. Defines style classes using a metaclass to parse style definitions and provide token-to-style mapping for code colorization.

## Key Components

### ANSI Color Mappings (L14-55)
- `_ansimap` (L14-33): Maps ANSI color names to RGB hex values (dark and bright variants)
- `_deprecated_ansicolors` (L35-54): Maps deprecated #ansixxx format to new color names
- `ansicolors` (L55): Set of all valid ANSI color names

### StyleMeta Metaclass (L58-168)
Primary metaclass that processes style definitions when Style classes are created.

**Key Methods:**
- `__new__` (L60-124): Processes style definitions, creates internal `_styles` dict mapping tokens to 9-element style arrays [color, bold, italic, underline, bgcolor, border, roman, sans, mono]
- `colorformat` (L66-79): Internal function validates color formats (hex, ANSI, CSS variables)
- `style_for_token` (L126-154): Returns formatted style dict for a token with color translation and boolean flags
- `list_styles` (L156-157): Returns list of all tokens
- `styles_token` (L159-160): Checks if token has style definition
- `__iter__` (L162-164): Yields (token, style_dict) pairs
- `__len__` (L166-167): Returns number of styled tokens

### Style Base Class (L170-203)
Base class for all Pygments styles with default appearance settings.

**Class Attributes:**
- `background_color` (L173): Overall background (#ffffff)
- `highlight_color` (L176): Highlight background (#ffffcc) 
- `line_number_color` (L179): Line number font color
- `line_number_background_color` (L182): Line number background
- `line_number_special_color` (L185): Special line number color
- `line_number_special_background_color` (L188): Special line number background
- `styles` (L191): Token-to-style mapping dict (empty base)
- `name` (L195): Style identifier string
- `aliases` (L197): Alternative names list
- `web_style_gallery_exclude` (L203): Gallery visibility flag

## Architecture
Uses metaclass pattern to preprocess style definitions at class creation time. The metaclass ensures all STANDARD_TYPES tokens have entries and converts string style definitions into normalized 9-element arrays for efficient runtime access. Supports inheritance through parent token relationships and provides both deprecated and modern ANSI color compatibility.
